from collections import Counter
class Solution:
    def minimumDistance(self, points: List[List[int]]) -> int:
        res = float('inf')
        x_plus_y = [x + y for x, y in points]
        x_minus_y = [x - y for x, y in points]
        
        cnt_x_plus_y = Counter(x_plus_y)
        cnt_x_minus_y = Counter(x_minus_y)
        
        x_plus_y_keys = sorted(list(cnt_x_plus_y.keys()))
        x_minus_y_keys = sorted(list(cnt_x_minus_y.keys()))
        
        for i in range(len(points)):
            a, b = x_plus_y[i], x_minus_y[i]
            max_a = x_plus_y_keys[-1] if (a!=x_plus_y_keys[-1] or cnt_x_plus_y[x_plus_y_keys[-1]]>1) else x_plus_y_keys[-2]
            min_a = x_plus_y_keys[0] if (a!=x_plus_y_keys[0] or cnt_x_plus_y[x_plus_y_keys[0]]>1) else x_plus_y_keys[1]
            max_b = x_minus_y_keys[-1] if (b!=x_minus_y_keys[-1] or cnt_x_minus_y[x_minus_y_keys[-1]]>1) else x_minus_y_keys[-2]
            min_b = x_minus_y_keys[0] if (b!=x_minus_y_keys[0] or cnt_x_minus_y[x_minus_y_keys[0]]>1) else x_minus_y_keys[1]
            res = min(res, max(max_a - min_a, max_b - min_b))
            
        return res
